values:
Raaaagghhhh, what is wrong with me?  This connects to the whole artist fear thing from earlier, but... why do I care what random people I admire on the internet think of me?  I don't give a shit about people in real life.  I have the utmost confidence in myself in everyday situations.  What is it about joining a community of artists that love the same things I do that fills me with a supremely frustrating mix of 'WANT' and 'they're all gonna laugh at you!'  And this is about a freaking dA group, by the way.  Just a group of gryphon artists doing challenges that I desperately want to join but equally desperately don't want to get rejected by.  So I fret and get ideas and do nothing in the end.  Fukit.

In other news, Jinn finally bought a car.  Some little Volvo (yes, the vulva jokes have commenced) that he's in the process of insuring and then he gets to move in.  Yaaayyy!  It only took a year.  >.>  


And in Texas:
Mama:	I think there's some question involved with my chicks' paternity
Mama:	some of them are developing... *gulp*  top hat feathers
kalinaperegryph:	Ooooooo
kalinaperegryph:	Hahahahaha
kalinaperegryph:	Roosteroo got cuckolded
kalinaperegryph:	Or would it be... COCKolded?
kalinaperegryph:	Haaaa, I crack myself up
Mama:	hahahaha
Mama:	poor roosterooooo
Mama:	he might notta made babies, but at least he got himself some

I woke this morning fully intending to go to work.  I got dressed, made my lunch, and sat down at the computer to waste the last 30 minutes before I needed to head out.  Big mistake.  I opened Minecraft and got involved in a project to make a floor of lava.  When the time to leave came around, I decided that I really didn't need to go in today and called out.  Then I finished my lava floor (which is awesome, by the way), chased the cat around for a bit, and made an ice cream date with Jinn.  After said ice cream we went for a walk at the local state forest during which there may have been attempts to throw each other into the lake and a pine cone fight.  I couldn't say.  But then the sun went down.

I understand now why people go nuts in the winter and end up killing their housemates.  After it got dark and we were forced to go inside or risk mauling and rape (not by each other,) I got sooooo restless.  I wanted to go do physical activities but going anywhere that was lit means dealing with random asshats of society and I just can't bring myself to do that.  So I got a taste of what the rest of the winter will be like and it was bitter, bitter, bitter and ended up with a lot of sniping at Jinn until I took him home.  Can't wait until he moves in.



P.S.  I absolutely hate the fact that I get whined at if I don't check out every link he sends me (which is usually something from 4chan involving penises) but refuses to look at anything I link because he doesn't trust random sites.  I think I know how to be careful on the internet by now and besides, he uses NoScript too and if I haven't gotten a virus yet he won't either.  And also besides, I'M NOT LINKING FUCKING PENIS PICTURES.

I have no biscuits and some honey, and an intense desire for biscuits and honey.  I also want chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream, and only have vanilla.  Damn my inherent laziness and the fact that it's too damn cold outside and I will likely die before I can get the heater in the Jeep warmed up.

I guess I didn't need them anyways...

I know all about artist block, I've had it many many times. But lately I've been having a different issue. I finally got my tablet and photoshop issues fixed, got my scanner drivers updated so it's working now, bought a new sketchbook that sits beside my bed for when I get those random urges to doodle... and I haven't done anything. The excuses flow fast and profuse- Oh, I need to do something in this game or oh, I just want to read a few chapters first. But in the end I think I am afraid to try and do actual art again. All I've shoveled out lately is those stupid VHR pictures. I have plenty of ideas, concepts, whatnot. My brain screams with things to try... but I can't seem to get up the courage to pick up a damned pencil. It's been years since I really put forth my all into an attempt. What if I've lost it? Granted nothing I've done is outstanding but to be even worse? Scary scary. Anyone else ever have this feeling?

It's so lonely here!  Dad just drove up from Texas for a visit and left yesterday.  I didn't think I would miss him so badly seeing as we're still in the process of shoring up our relationship but I do.  It was a really good visit, we showed him a lot of the local outdoor parks and whatnot.  So, a good week all in all.

I finally got into an apartment thanks to Mom's help.  Still bugging Jinn to get a paying job so he can move in with me.  Got yet another job, this time at a grocery store.  I'm such a loser.  >.<  But it pays the bills and I've finally got my internet back after 6 months without it.  And I'm not a frothing insane mess!  Go me!

I can't stand xmas music.  Every douchebag thinks they need to rehash the old classics songs and put 'their own new modern touch' to them.  Leave the music until xmas week, at the very most, and just play the old ones we all grew up with.  We don't need to hear the latest and upcoming artists renditions of the same old shit for over a month before the holiday.  Bah humbug.

Gah, I'm so bad at this.  Anyways, found the cat.  She'd been hiding under a nasty old couch in the basement for a week.  Not stuck, she's just neurotic and wouldn't come out.  We finally coaxed her out and then Jinn and a friend of his cleaned out all the old furniture down here and cat-proofed it.  She bounced back, gained weight and since then has become amazingly... bouncy.  I mean it's just weird.  She takes flying leaps across the room to chase string and cannonballs up and down the stairs for no reason.  She seems so happy, and is still a little lap slut.  So yay, my cat is fine.
Well fuck.  I've tried twice to post a damn entry and it keeps eating them.  Summing it up again, my cat is missing and I don't have the slightest idea where she is.  And I start a new job Monday.

Wow, so it's been almost 2 years since I actually posted in this journal?  Sheesh.  Let's see, what's been going on?  The socialness I was bitching about in the last couple of posts?  I have packed up and moved halfway across the country for the guy that prompted that.  We've been living together for a year now and still doing great, thank goodness.  All mushyness aside, I'd be comfortable saying that Jinn's who I will be growing old with.  We know each other's faults and are able to ignore or deal with them.  >.>  On a side note, the road trip from Texas to Massachusetts was AWESOME!  Minus the gas prices last summer.  We took a week off and just cruised, no rush no hurry.  Some of those little tourist trap areas were neat, like a freshwater pearl farm and a cavern with a river running through it.

Jobwise, I am unemployed again.  *sighs*  I was working at Lowe's for a while in the cash office until I transferred up here.  The store I moved to said they needed a cash office person, but when I got here they used me to give the two girls in there already their vacations, and then stuck me on the registers every day.  I thought it was a raw deal myself.  So I looked up a placement agency who found me an admin assistant job with an offshoot of DHL.  Tried it for about six months and just could not deal with the HR manager who was one of my two bosses.  I have never, NEVER worked for such a freaking bitch.  I try to keep my head low and get along with everyone at work, rocking the boat is never really worth it unless you're absolutely miserable.  But this lady was just incredibly rude to everyone!  And she's HR!!  I saw so many people leave because of her but she was always polite and brown-nosed to the higher ups.  So I left there and the agency placed me on a temporary job with a pottery company filing paperwork and helping the shipping coordinator get pallets labeled and ready to go on the trucks.  While the job itself wasn't all that fun, the people were great and I really wish it could have turned into a permanent job.  Oh well.  That one ended two weeks ago and I'm waiting on the agency to find yet another one for me.

My mom came up for a visit this past week while I was out of work.  I'm always glad to see her and we had a wonderful time.  She, Jinn, and I went on a whale watch tour and it was spectacular!  Being out on the open water was so enjoyable and there was so much life out there between seals and various waterfowl.  And, of course, the two humpbacks that decided to play right around our boat.  They were amazing!  And so close, one that was very curious about us kept spy-hopping not eight feet away from where I was standing at the railing.  I'll have to finally download all the pictures off my camera and post some of them on here.

Time to go play some WoW...
So I lied, and now am back.  To be expanded on later!
Ending this journal and moving elsewhere.  See you!

So, I've been single for 4 years this past July.  And celibate.  Not really by choice, but just from lack of available and/or desirable ass.  It really hasn't been an issue, it's like the hormones turned off (or, as my best friend suspects, they went to him).  Anyways, in the past month or so I've switched servers on WoW to join up with some old friends from Grendel's Revenge.  They have a Ventrilo server so we've been voicechatting back and forth while gaming.  Interesting effect- speaking with people my age and with my interests seems to have sparked the hormones again.  So apparently my iron will and 'turn off switch' I've been so proud of for the past 4 years is all bullshit.  Having decent conversations and getting flirted with turns out to suck for me!  I should just go back to IMs and guild chat.  And I damn sure don't want to be tempted by people that live several states away, that's just setting up for stupidity!  Blehness.  Sometimes I wish all my girl parts would just fall out.

On a happier note, I've lost 35 pounds so far after the surgery.  Pretty happy about that.  I also have come to the decision that my art sucks.  It's flat and boring and the shading is monochromatic and there's no atmosphere and my anatomy sucks and... and... etc.  Though my skins seem to be fairly popular in Second Life.  But as far as actual pictures... fleh.  If anyone has some tips on how to choose colors that give a bit of atmosphere but keep the general color impression you want to give, please share.  I'm desperate!  My muse has been slamming me upside the head with the idea bat but she screams and cries when I can't get it out correctly.  And now... peanut butter and crackers.  Nom nom nom.

Yeah, I kinda forget this journal sometimes.  To update, I just had gastric banding surgery two weeks ago.  Everything is going well with that, hopefully will continue to do so and I can get back down to a healthy weight.  Not a lot going on, spend most of my time playing WoW and working on art stuffs.  I'll be trying to remember this and get onto a regular posting schedule, but I'm not holding my breath for it either.  Anyways, I've gotten birds again and have long since sold my horse.  Two out of three cats are still around.  And... um... that's all I can think of for now.

Um... yeah... I haven't died. >.> To show what's been occupying my time and to test my html skills, have a gander at this:

Loot! Spoil! Slay! Hoard!
You play monsters. All sorts of monsters. And kill people... Heeheehee!

Here's your pic!  Hope ya like it ;)

http://www.deviantart.com/view/8673699/

Primo-badass day.  Played hooky from work, been looking at horses for the past week and finally decided on one, bought said horse, celebrated "day-before-birthday" with Mom, got pied in the face (I'm still sneezing whipped cream), and have now come home to crash.  I am now the proud owner of a 5 year-old buckskin quarterhorse gelding named Butter.  We may or may not be changing that name though.  *beams happily*  Gotta go talk to one of the stables I've checked out tomorrow to see about setting up a stall, then finish tacking up and I'll be set!  Happy birthday indeed!

Quote of the day:

Never hold your farts in.  They travel up your spine, into your brain, and that's where you get shitty ideas from.  ^_^

In the space of two weeks I have been thoroughly de-birded.  Someone broke into my apartment and stole my yellow-naped amazon and my cockatiel, the only remaining birds.  Cages are still there.  Cats are still there.  Nothing else taken.  My electricity has been shut off because I forgot to pay my water bill and I now have an eviction notice and owe the complex $1400.  Over a 31.70 water bill.  Un-fucking-beleivable.

Motoko, my sun conure, died last night.  No warning, no symptoms, just laying in the bottom of her cage when I woke up.  She was the closest to me of my birds.  My little protector.  I will love you always Baby Bird.

Shitty fucking day.

It was a pleasure drawing you again!  ;)  Hope you like it.

http://www.deviantart.com/view/6274778/

My journal is called _____ because _____.
My subtitle is _____ because _____.
My friends page is called _____ because _____.
My username is ____ because _____.

My journal is called Ignorance and Apathy because it describes my basic attitude about most things.  My subtitle is I don't know and I don't care because it explains the title.  My friends page is the default because I'm too lazy to change it. ;)  My username is KalinaPeregryph because thats just me.

Well that was fun.  I'm so bored right now.

Hrm... what to say, what to say... The job's still good, and I'm becoming used to being on my feet all day.  I can't seem to go a week without getting pissed on though. >.<  I've missed unemployment solely for my social life... working so much has cut my time with friends, online and IRL, down to almost nothing.  Sucks, but I'll deal.  The paychecks tend to make me burble in utter glee, so that's always a good thing.  *pats her premium GR account*  Now I can afford the nice games that I love and have no time for.  Poor Rezzit too, she's worked her butt off for my grulla horse in VHR and I hardly have time to work with it.  *sniffles*  Ah well, I've run out of things to babble about for now.

Your aura shines Orange!

What Color Is Your Aura?
brought to you by Quizilla True for the most part. My job rocks! Well, besides the cleaning of massive amounts of SHIT. Oh well, I expected that. Of course, now my friends have given me titles like "stray- nuzzler" and "specialized waste removal consultant and technitian". The only bad thing is at the end of every day I feel like taking a hacksaw to my ankles. My feet hurt so bad! Hopefully I'll get used to it soon.
Because I can't resist bandwagons.  *points to new icon*

I GOT A JOB!!! Working for the SPCA as a direct animal care person. Whoop! Edit: How did I know this was coming?
Heart of Stone

What is Your Heart REALLY Made of?
brought to you by Quizilla *ponders* I haven't been reading the past few days, so I'm not sure where this question thing came from. Oh well, ask away if ya like.

So yah... I'm so bored and yet I can't seem to sleep.  *points at new pic*  Is Lasair, the bitchy gryph half of me.  Hrm... I really don't have anything worthwhile to say.  Got an interview on Friday with the SPCA, so I'm pretty psyched about that.  Been playing GR and VHR a lot, harassing Mighty Mummy to help me move large amounts of items because he can carry 20 at a time compared to my dinky little one item limit.  Sometimes being chimera sucks.  Counting myself blessed for having wonderful friends.  I loves ya all!  Expecially Rezzers, cause she breeds me extraordinary horses that whoop ass on the endurance fields.  *toddles off to find other people to annoy*

Marriage is love.
Heh, it's rare for me to actually bother to show support for something, but this one is definately worth it.

Busy busy busy... 

Monday: Went to welfare office and applied for food stamps which I will most likely not get because I was extremely tired and I get weird when lack of sleep kicks in.  The woman that interviewed me gave odd looks.  I think I was hissing a children around, but not sure, can't remember.  Yes, I'm am also being lack of sleepish now.

Tuesday: Went to psych appointment.  Was told I'm depressed and need medication for the third time by the woman.  Uh... no?  I don't care to become a zombie from meds and I'm not depressed just because I don't like people and get irritated easily.  When I get a job I'll perk up.

Wednesday: Um... I don't think I did anything besides read a lot.

Thursday: Went to court yet again for the same speeding ticket and still didn't see the damn judge.  Speeding part was dismissed, on probation for 6 months for no insurance.  It had to lapse the one week I was pulled over!  >.<  Experienced my first eggs benedict (sp?) which are totally kick ass.

Friday: Devoted to sending out applications, playing GR, playing VHR.  *huggles Rezzit*  I have spiffy horses.  I also have 30 custom pics for said horses now.  Go me.

On a side note, I have found a community that I love for the child free individuals.  Bliss!
I adopted a cute lil' dragon fetus from Fetusmart! Hooray fetus! Blame Rezzit, she showed it to me. *cackles and runs off*

Well, just got back from another scare with my mother.  Everything's fine, she's just got a pain in her side that worried her.  X-rays showed nothing there so the doctors think she's just pulled something.  *sighs wearily*

My mom's got hyperpulmonary tension.  It's basically where the capillaries between the heart and lungs stiffen and decrease the oxygen flow.  She was diagnosed with it (correctly) about 3 years ago and nights like tonight are becoming more and more common.  There are so many ways things can go wrong for her...  One major thing is she's got a pump that shoots her medication straight into her heart so lots of things can get screwy with that.  Risk of infection, contamination of the valve site on her chest, pump malfunction... you get the picture.  Then there's the physical side.  It's just so fucked up.  No one should cringe every time their mom calls because they're afraid it might be bad news.

I'm just going to go pass out now, I'm so tired.

Just sticking me head in for a minute to let everyone know I'm still alive.  Been caught up in jobhunting, Grendel's Revenge, and VHR.  Heh.  Okay, I'm out again.  Oh, lots of new art up at my DA account, go see!

Christmas was good.  I'm now reuniting with long lost loved ones... i.e.- I got a PS2 and my games out of the pawn shop.  Swamped with request pics, so if I promised you one it's in the works!  Erm, you may want to remind me though... horrible memory and all.  Oh, Rezzit- do you play VHR?  If so what breeds do you go for?  And can anyone give me pointers on making mood icons here?  Especially like what program to use and how to make the transparent backgrounds.  Thankee!

Dear Santa,

I have been a good girl.

It really wasn't my fault what happened at Chris's Christmas party. It was Christy who spiked the punch with too much vodka. I can't help it if I drank 25 glasses. It was so good---smelled and tasted just like feather dust.

I thought it was funny when I put Camille's thong on my head and danced the waltz on the entertainment center while singing `I Will Survive'. I didn't mean to break Chris's toaster and don't know why Chris would sue me for public indecency.

I don't remember calling Mike's wife a disgusting cow---even though she looked like one with neon green eye shadow and red lipstick!

And when I threw up on Christy's husband's ear, it was only because I ate too much of that sausage.

After all that fun, I admit I was a little tired. So I fell asleep on my way home and drove my backhoe through my neighbor's kitchen. I don't think that was any reason for my neighbor to call me a giddy wallaby and have me arrested for arson!

So, Santa...here I sit in my jail cell on Christmas Eve, all sweet and gurgly. And I'm really not to blame for any of this drunken stuff. Please bring me what I want the most---bail money!

Sincerely and quickly yours,
Kalina (Really a nice girl!)

P.S. It's only 13 bucks!

Well, I'd say it's been an eventful week but it hasn't... I just haven't been home most of it. The earlier part was spent over at Mike and Christy's because they feed me. :) I came home periodically to check on the critters and cuss at the fleas that have invaded my apartment. If anyone has suggestions on how to deal with them safely around the birds please tell me. Friday I went to see my mother's therapist because it made Mom happy. Apparently I'm depressed (no shit?) and have a negative self image (really?). And I need to resign myself to a shithole job because a craptacular paycheck is better than none at all. I know all of this, I didn't need to go see a total stranger to find it out. Ah well. Horsies...
I have found out that in Ultima Online if you drink 30 pitchers of ale at a time, you stay drunk for 4 days... so far anyways.

Well, happy turkey day.  I learned how to make devilled eggs.

Er... yeah.

1. Name: Cory Payne/ Kalina
2. When did you start drawing?: Since I could hold a pencil
3. Colors you like: Royal Blue, Black, Blood Red
4. Colors you tend to over use: reds
5. Colors you don't like: Brights, yellows, and pastels
6. Colors you don't like using: Um... the ones that don't fit the piece
7.a How long does it take you to ink?: Not long, but most of my stuff is digital anyways
7.b Color?: Anywhere from 4-5 hours to a week, depends on how into the piece I am
8.a Average time to finish a picture: See 7b
8.b Quickest good drawing you've done from start to finish: Timed anatomy drawing- 1 hour
8.c Quickest sketchy drawing you've done from start to finish: 1 minute, another timed one
8.d Longest time spent on a picture: A huge pastel still life that took me a month of classes
9.a What do you think are your strongest points in art?: Color, texturing... anatomy somewhat
9.b Weakest points?: Atmosphere, backgrounds, realism
10. Things you have trouble drawing?: Humans and bears
11.a Preferred media?: Photoshop
11.b Disliked media: Watercolor
12. Usual supplies used: comp with the program, sketchbook, and a Wacom
13.a Sketchbook or sheets of paper?: Sketchbook preferably, whatever is at hand
13.b Why?: I lose things too easily and my cats like to sleep on paper
14. Art books you own? Anatomy, 2 big birds of prey, Birds of North America, that's about it
15. Biggest influences on your style?: *eyeshift*  Nambroth for backgrounds and texture, Likeshine for line quality, my old art teacher for anatomy
16.a Listen to music while drawing?: If I remember to turn on the radio and my birds aren't in a "scream along to the music" mood
16.b If yes, which bands/songs are your biggest inspiration?: Everything... I get lots of picture ideas from moods and lyrics in songs
17. What inspires you?: Better to ask what doesn't... mostly nature inspires me
18. Areas you'd like to improve on?: Everything
19.a Which part of drawing do you dislike the most?: Backgrounds!
19.b Like the most?: Color work, putting in shadows and highlights and watching it come alive, so to speak
20.a Lastly, want to do something with your talent?: Yep, but I don't think it will happen
20.b If so, what?: I'd like to do monster design for RPG games like Final Fantasy... you need a lot of different monsters and that's what I love to draw

I think I've caught up fairly well on my movies... today Don and I went to see Runaway Jury, and last night Chris and I rented The Recruit, 28 Days Later, and Darkness Falls.  I have now reconfirmed that 1) I have no faith in our judicial system, 2) Collin Farrell (sp?) is a sexy bitch and I like my Pacino evil *grins*, 3) chicks with machetes are sexy bitches, and 4)... um... stay in the light?

It is now officially ~fucking cold~ outside so I'm trying not to venture out in it.  Playing the waiting game to see if the interview went well or not.  Getting insane sugar highs off the butter cups Chris gave me.  And that's about it right now.  *putters off*

Kalina: You think I'm seeexy... you wanna kiiiss me.  I liked that movie.
Chris: So did I.  That's kinda sad.
Kalina: What?  That we both liked a Sanda Bullock movie?
Chris: Yeah.  I think I'll have to commit hurdy gurdy now.
Kalina: ...
Kalina: You mean hari kari?
Chris: Oh bite me.


Well, the job interview went alright.  I confessed that I had no idea how to work Quark but I impressed the lady by how quickly I picked it up.  It's kinda like Illustrator.  So I'll know by Wednesday whether I'm employed or not.  And now it's time to go drink and be stupid!  Yaaayyy!

I've got an interview tomorrow.  Well, not really... it's a placement test and a "talk", but I'm still nervous as hell about it.  They are supposed to be testing me in Photoshop (no prob) and Quark (I've never even opened the program).  I just don't want to get my hopes up because I really don't have anything going for me to get the position, but I sooo need a job!  And this one would rock because the hours are 8pm to 4 am.  How cool is that?  *mutters*  I still have things to get together tonight so I'm out of here.

Bat eyes for you. The term "blind as a
bat" matches you well. You see the things
that you wish to see. Everything else is
darkness for you. You're in your own tunnel. If
something happens, then it happens...whether
it's bad or not. You don't like to interact
with the outside world much. You just do things
because you need to. You like to be alone.
Cheer up a bit. You may be missing a lot that
could be open to you.

What Animal Eyes Do You Have?
brought to you by Quizilla The sad part is it's pretty true. "You're the kind of girl that makes good guys go bad." ... What the fuck? So said one of my friends today and it made me feel suprisingly good... I haven't been complimented (however twistedly) in a while. Ah well. This was an eventful couple of days... nasty flooding and tornadoes around the area, but thankfully my apartment complex is high and fairly dry. I was stuck in Channelview with no passable freeways home so the pets had to fend for themselves for a couple of days. No biggie, the birds had overloaded bowls when I left and the cats are just fatasses that whine even when they have food in the bowl. But, I was still worried about them. I guess what little maternal instinct I have kicked in. Now they are all being major brats. Go figure. Oh well, my babies love me.

The nation's biggest known outbreak of hepatitis A is causing such a panic that people are lining up by the thousands for antibody shots and no longer eating out.
http://www.cnn.com/2003/HEALTH/conditions/11/15/hepatitis.outbreak.ap/index.html

This article just has waaay too much innuendo in it for me to not laugh.

APRIL:
Active and dynamic.(Lazy and tends to grow mold) Decisive and haste but tends to regret.(Takes years to make a decision) Attractive and affectionate to oneself.(Not likely) Strong mentality.(I certainly hope so) Loves attention.(Debatable) Diplomatic. Consoling, friendly and solves people's problems.(Only with good friends) Brave and fearless.(Hm, untested in this regard) Adventurous.(When I get out of the house) Loving and caring.(Again, with friends) Suave and generous.(Suave? I'm blunt, not suave) Emotional. Aggressive.(You better bet) Hasty. Good memory.(*cackles*) Moving Motivates oneself and others.(Not a motivator) Sickness usually of the head and chest.(*cackles again* Sick in the head is right!  Prone to colds too, I guess) Sexy in a way that only their luver can see.(I don't have any lovers right now so that just proves it's own point)
